data.title: Bardeen, James Maxwell, 1939
data.text:
James Maxwell Bardeen

Dates

May 9, 1939 – present

Authorized Form of Name

Bardeen, James Maxwell, 1939-

Additional Forms of Names

Bardeen, James M.

Biography

Abstract

James Bardeen has made major contributions in general relativity and cosmology. He discovered the Bardeen vacuum, an exact solution of the Einstein field equation.

May 9, 1939Birth, Minneapolis (Minn.).

1960Obtained AB, Harvard University, Cambridge (Mass.).

1965Research Fellow, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena (Calif.).

1965Obtained PhD, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena (Calif.).

1966Post-graduate Research Physicist, University of California, Berkeley.

1967 – 1972Assistant Professor of Astronomy (1967-1970) and Associate Professor of Astronomy (1970-1972), University of Washington, Seattle (Wash.).

1968 – 1969Senior Fellow, Center for Theoretical Physics, University of Maryland.

1972 – 1976Associate Professor of Physics and Astronomy (1972-1974) and Professor of Physics and Astronomy (1974-1976), Yale University, New Haven (Conn.).

1973 – 1976Member, Advisory Screening Committee in Astronomy, Committee on International Exchange of Persons (Fulbright).

1976 – presentProfessor of Physics (1976-2006) and Emeritus Professor of Physics (2006-present), University of Washington, Seattle (Wash.).

1977Fairchild Distinguished Scholar, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena (Calif.).

1979 – 1980Member, Institute for Advanced Study.

1983 – 1984Member, Institute for Theoretical Physics, University of California, Santa Barbara.

1995 – 1998Member, Executive Committee on the Topical Group on Gravitation and General Relativity, American Physical Society.

2012Member, National Academy of Science.

Occupation

Astrophysicist.
